comments.body: change this comment as I suggested for configmap
note to self: find a way to genericize this
I am worried about this longer term, but I guess it is OK for now.  long term it should have its own ticker an refresh loop.

An example layout might help here:

```
Example:

.../volume-dir/
.../volume-dir/.current.12345678
.../volume-dir/.current.12345678/pod-name
.../volume-dir/.current -> .current.12345678
.../volume-dir/pod-name -> .current/pod-name
```
This will break if anyone says "foo//bar" - you should call CleanPath() on the path names when you originally save them, so that this becomes safe.
This doesn't feel right.  If f starts as "foo/bar", dir will be "foo" and  nbOfSubdir will be 0.  That will make the wrong symlink below.  What am I missing?
never mind the last - I tested it in playground.  filepath.split leaves the trailing "/".  Can you just add a comment about that here?
